title: How to Prepare Chicken Biryani with Masala

parts.name: Grinding the spices to make masala

steps.headline: Grind the cinnamon, cloves, elachi, cashew, javithri, dried red chillies coarsely, forming a powder.
Add the mint leaves, ginger, garlic, pearl onions.
steps.description: Grind into a smooth paste. This forms the masala.

steps.headline: Wash and rinse the rice.
steps.description: Soak it in water for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Heat the oil and a little ghee in a cooker.
Add the bay leaf.
steps.description: After the oil is hot, add Kalpasi / Black Stone Flower, bay leaf. When it splutters, add chopped onions and fry well. Once the onions turn transparent, add the ground masala.

steps.headline: Sauté until the oil oozes out of the mixture.
steps.description: The raw smell will go away.

steps.headline: Add a handful of mint leaves, chopped tomato and green chillies.
Sauté well till it becomes a fine paste and the oil oozes out.
Add chicken to this paste and little water.
steps.description: Keep the lid closed till the chicken is half cooked. This will take about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add 4 cups of water.
steps.description: Remember, that you will have already added some water to cook the chicken. Add a pinch of sugar to enhance the taste.

steps.headline: Check the taste of the water.
Let the water boil.
steps.description: When it boils well, add the soaked rice and mix it well.

steps.headline: Close the lid slightly for 2 minutes.
Add 1 teaspoon of coriander powder and mix it well.
Close the lid of the cooker and pressure cook until 3 whistles.
steps.description: After that, the biryani is ready.

steps.headline: Serve it piping hot with onion raitha.

text: Grinding the spices to make masala Grind the cinnamon, cloves, elachi, cashew, javithri, dried red chillies coarsely, forming a powder.  Add the mint leaves, ginger, garlic, pearl onions. Grind into a smooth paste. This forms the masala. Cooking the biryani Wash and rinse the rice. Soak it in water for 10 minutes. Heat the oil and a little ghee in a cooker.  Add the bay leaf. After the oil is hot, add Kalpasi / Black Stone Flower, bay leaf. When it splutters, add chopped onions and fry well. Once the onions turn transparent, add the ground masala. Sauté until the oil oozes out of the mixture. The raw smell will go away. Add a handful of mint leaves, chopped tomato and green chillies.  Add salt to taste.  Sauté well till it becomes a fine paste and the oil oozes out.  Add chicken to this paste and little water. Keep the lid closed till the chicken is half cooked. This will take about 5 minutes. Add 4 cups of water. Remember, that you will have already added some water to cook the chicken. Add a pinch of sugar to enhance the taste. Check the taste of the water. It should be slightly salty. Let the water boil. When it boils well, add the soaked rice and mix it well. Close the lid slightly for 2 minutes.  Add 1 teaspoon of coriander powder and mix it well.  Close the lid of the cooker and pressure cook until 3 whistles. After that, the biryani is ready. Serve it piping hot with onion raitha.
